info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 18 at 6:22PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A snow squall will affect Jo Daviess...Northern Stephenson... Buchanan...Dubuque and Delaware counties through 715 PM CST... At 621 PM CST, a snow squall was located along a line extending from near Monticello to Rickardsville to near Fairbank. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Snow and wind gusts up to 50 mph SOURCE...Radar...Observations and Cameras IMPACTS...Ice covered surfaces including roadways, bridges, overpasses, and sidewalks. Locations impacted include... Dubuque, Independence, Manchester, Galena, Asbury, Dyersville, Lena, Jesup, Cascade, Stockton, Epworth, East Dubuque, Farley, Warren, Peosta, Fairbank, Edgewood, Winthrop, Hanover and Hazleton. This includes Interstate 380 between mile markers 49 and 55. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this snow squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads could lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until the squall passes your location. A rapid drop in temperatures will lead to the rapid formation of black ice on area roadways. Black ice is nearly impossible to see and roadways may appear wet. Please use extreme caution, especially on bridges, overpasses and around curves. Allow plenty of stopping distance and avoid braking suddenly.
